title: 有冇哥哥姐姐可以幫手譯呢個post

replies.msg: https://lihkg.com/thread/1745831/page/1
唔好俾手足消失
想放上Twitter
引起大家關注
求幫忙
希望大家唔好俾消防局得逞
Push
Push
bookmarked

譯得唔係幾好希望你唔好介意
Just now the Hong Kong Fire Services Department (HKFSD) announced a new arrangement: the latest manual suggests that all first aiders shall not bring along their name tags with them during operation, which means that before an operation begins, all first aiders must selectively hand in their name tags, such that citizens don’t even know the one offering them treatment is really a first-aider or a police officer. There is also a possibility that a first-aider would be “disappeared” (i.e. secretly arrested or kidnapped or any other ways to make a person vanish all of a sudden).

Now the HKFSD argues that this new manual is in place to protect the first aiders and to relieve their stress while working at the front line, but in fact, instead of offering a blanket protection to their colleagues, they are setting bad precedent to rationalise the action of police officers not displaying their warrant cards. Undoubtedly, this would lower our confidence towards the first aiders given the impossibility of verifying their true identities.

It is suspected with this new measure, some undercover may pretend as first aiders to arrest the injured. To protect yourself, next time when you see a first aider without a name tag or in general, if you have any suspicion, be sure to ask for proof and question them on their medical knowledge. Never say the truth to them before you can ascertain their identities.

According to reliable source, this new manual was released right after the meeting between the HKFSD Ambulancemen’s Union and the Deputy Commissioner of the HKFSD. Can our fellow first aiders call the Union and ask for the reasons of implementing such measure? Have they ever consulted the colleagues? This was told by my first aider friend and in case you don’t trust me, you are always welcome to doxx me.

The following is quoted from my first aider friend:

What is the difference between we, the first aiders and those trashy police officers? I hope that our colleagues are that stupid … Why did the HKFSD kneel down in front of this tyranny? Now we sync with the police officers in not displaying our professional credentials? When it is no longer required to have a name tag with us, it is so easy for the undercover to pretend as first aiders. Now people must think badly of the HKFSD… Anyways, the public must be aware of such “nametag-less” first aiders. Sometimes I even think that it is better for people to distrust the first aiders so that they will not be sent to the hospital that fast (you know hospital is not a safe place after all). I honestly don’t know how long can we hold still to our principles at the front line so guys, please spread this news to everyone within your circles and we need everyone to be aware of this evil move.

【泛民請入】一齊加速抗爭進度 引爆憲政危機
https://lih.kg/1754584
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區

replies.msg:
落咗奶力希望幫到手
Don’t just dwell upon the victory of the 2019 District Council Election! Besides rescuing our brothers in PolyU, there are a bunch of things that we do and we shall keep fighting until there is universal suffrage in Hong Kong! We must share this post to pressurise the local government in giving us a proper response and to await intervention from the US.

Anyways, the main point is to wipe out the functional constituency in full, but not to perfect it, so as to implement universal suffrage. Therefore, how the new District Councillors use this chance to shaken the status of Edward Lau Kwok-fan (a member of the executive committee of the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong and member of the North District Council, representing Yan Shing) is definitely the key in this uphill battle for democracy.

Below is an extract from http://bit.ly/2rqCmnW:

When Edward Lau Kwok-fan lost in the 2019 District Council Election, does it mean that he lost his qualification as a member of the District Council (first) functional constituency?

Let’s not talk about the ordinances. In this situation, anyone with a sense of shame would have resigned before the start of any procedure (in relation to expunging one from his seat). If a Councillor from the medical field has his licence suspended, it means that he has lost his qualification in representing that field, and so not resigning from his role means nothing but shaming himself.

According to section 39(4) of the Legislative Council Ordinance (Cap 542), a person is also disqualified from being elected as a Member for a functional constituency (other than the District Council (first) functional constituency and the District Council (second) functional constituency) if, since the close of nominations, the person has ceased to have a substantial connection with the constituency.

Yet, thanks to the “pocket-it-first/adopt-it-first” scheme, the 2012 amendment excludes the District Council (first) functional constituency and the District Council (second) functional constituency from the limitation under section 39 of the said Ordinance. It is crystal clear that in the process of making such amendment, no thorough consideration has been given to the circumstance of which the Legislative Council members belonging to certain District Councils, lose in their respective District Council Elections.

replies.msg:
Despite of the defeat of Holden Chow Ho-ding in the District Council Election, he is still qualified to be a councillor of the District Council (second) functional constituency. That is because if he is disqualified, then it is just the same as depriving him of the authorisation given by those 264,399 voters.

However, the District Council (first) functional constituency is created by the indirect election among those 452 District Councillors. The commencement of another new term of the District Council signifies that the electorate base of Edward Lau Kwok-fan has become nothing but history. Put it in other words, there is no one in the Legislative Council to present the rights and voices of all 452 District Councillors. In foreign countries, this is just the same as triggering a constitutional crisis that requires the constitutional courts to fix this lacuna by way of delivering a verdict. Edward Lau Kwok-fan should really resign from his role to prevent further challenges posed to the Hong Kong constitution and to relieve the local government from another trouble.

Anyways, the main point is to wipe out the functional constituency in full, but not to perfect it, so as to implement universal suffrage. Therefore, how the new District Councillors use this chance to shaken the status of Edward Lau Kwok-fan (a member of the executive committee of the Democratic Alliance for the Betterment and Progress of Hong Kong and member of the North District Council, representing Yan Shing) is definitely the key in this uphill battle for democracy.
